reviewText: I enjoyed this movie. It gave a good summary of Joseph Campbell's background and what he discovered through his lifelong research about the common threads of all myths and spiritual stories. There were many good sound bites from authors and other famous people who overcame traumatic experiences and learned to "follow their bliss." The documentary was also visually stunning. It just didn't quite wow me.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have accumulated lots of DVDs, books, CDs of Joseph Campbell and this is a fine addition to the collection.
summary: Nice DVD to have in your Campbell collection
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you're already advanced research into the spiritual evolution of mankind and the direction that humanity has chosen for the planet, go ahead, this DVD is for beginners. It is a compilation album of interviews with famous people, writers, scholars... But if you've seen Living Matrix (Greg Becker) and I Am (Tom Shadyac), you will have the impression of already knowing the contents of this DVD. I also recommend Living Matrix and I Am.
Title: N/A

reviewText: suggested by a friend of mine, I ordered this. Some may be disappointed that there wasn't more footage of the man himself-in the special feature attached the director explains....they had to make a 5 hour movie into an hour and a half....so the feeling was to make it about the message, and not as much the messenger. and the message is defined....discussed, illustrated....it was entertaining....and makes you want to drop everything immediately and follow your bliss

reviewText: YES! Buy this! You cannot go wrong with this! I will be buying several for family & friends for whatever occasions!Joseph Campbell was one of the most logical yet enlightened men of his time.SO Worth seeing this several times!

reviewText: I loved this movie! It put everything I've always known into perfect order for a conceivable, relatable awareness of the workings of the Universe. The details that I wasn't clear on easily filled in and then eureka! The movie is filled with heart and emotion. It will go into my lending library for the clients of my Life Coaching ~ Healing practice. This was my first direct exposure to Joseph Campbell which may in part have to do with my enthusiasm for the movie. Either way it was well done in my opinion and I am extremely pleased to have it in my permanent library.
summary: It brings sense and order to what I could never completely convey with my own words

reviewText: Not quite what I was hoping for. Pretty much a series of trailer-like segments. A great intro to Mr. Cambell, say, like if you saw this on TV, as an infomercial. But, this is not an in-depth or illuminating documentary. Better to find all of Joseph Cambell's work and go through that, if you're already a fan.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I included Joseph Campbell in a university ethics course I taught for several years. I think he offered any number of important observations from which students can gain insights into belief systems. But the people in this film show an incredibly superficial understanding of Campbell--most of their observations limited to a handful of catch-phrases. Well you talk to a bunch of celebrities today and this is what you get. Please don't watch this and think you have an understanding of the man, his philosophies or ANY magical key to happiness. For the most part, Campbell ignored his own "teachings" and died without any core belief system, an atheist without "myths"...except his own books.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I found it a very uplifting and positive dvd.  That's what I look for.  Sure, I may have heard some of this before, but people don't read the bible or koran just once do they?  They refer to them again, and again, and again.  We all need reminding certain truths.
